page.title: 17RELIGION IN SEAMILL
page.content: {Religion}plays an important part in the life of any town and Seamill is no exception. There is a{Catholic church and there are two{Protestant Churches. There is also the{Barony Church, which, although no longer used for religious meetings, is still used as a meeting place for the Boys' Brigade. {House Church meetings}are held in private homes and the Community Centre. The people who go to these believe that going to private houses is a much better way to worship God than in a church. They think the people enjoy their religion more this way.{Mr Mitchell}is the minister of St Andrew's Church and{Mr {Cruickshanks}is the minister of Overton Church.{Canon Gunning}is the priest at St. Bride's Church. The people of his congregation are Roman Catholics and at his services they....
